location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Sketch Map of the Eastern Part of the Arabian Peninsula

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Manuscript; black and blue ink and crayon on paper.Dimensions: 370 x 250mm, on sheet 393 x 341mm.

mods.abstract: Sketch map depicting the eastern part of the Arabian Peninsula. The map includes various lines, which have been drawn in crayon and described in a corresponding key. These include the 'blue line' (laid down in the non-ratified Anglo-Ottoman Convention of 1913 and redefined and adopted in the Anglo-Ottoman convention of the following year), various lines considered by the British as possible territorial concessions, and a line representing the Saudi Government's claim to its country's eastern boundary.
